description: Medical expenses that meet IRS criteria to be paid using a tax-free withdrawal from a health savings account. You can find a list of qualified expenses in IRS Publication 502, “Medical and Dental Expenses.” They include dental and vision expenses, and must be primarily to alleviate or prevent a physical or mental defect or illness. If you use HSA money for non-qualified expenses, the funds will be taxed at your income tax rate plus a 20% penalty if you’re under 65.
title: Qualified Medical Expenses
